instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Wi-Fi
threads.message:
I've got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no Wi-Fi. AHT confirms the no Wi-Fi but this machine is newer than what I typically work on so I'm not sure where to start. No liquid damage, no other damage. Machine works great except Wi-Fi. Any pointers? :)

Looking at the schematic there is a lot more involved with the Wi-Fi than prior years/models. Figured the first thing I'm looking for is an enable or power line but having a hard time finding it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Wi-Fi
threads.message:
No hardware installed in System Report, for WiFi?
Check power rails for <CHIP>U3730</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Wi-Fi
threads.message: This was picked up before I could further investigate, can be marked as closed. Thanks for the help 2informaticos
